did.abstract: Henry George Austin Vicars was a British Army Adjutant during the Indian Mutinies of 1857 and 1858. Vicars served in India with the 61st Regiment of Foot and then the 18th Foot (Royal Irish). He was with the 61st when it fought from Ferozepore to Delhi during the Mutiny of 1857. In his diaries, dated 1853-1855, 1857-1860, and 1864-1865, he reports on the mutinies, the Delhi massacres, executing mutineers, cholera epidemics and fevers, and daily life as a soldier. He also touches on society in general, leave in England, and sermons.
